title: The Bridegroom Nigh
verses:
1. My heart was cold, lukewarm was I, When lo! I heard the Midnight Cry!
It around me up, I look'd within, Behold corruption, error, sin.

metadata.musical_notation: Present with treble and bass clef
metadata.theological_significance: References the parable of the ten virgins and the midnight cry, a central metaphor in Millerite theology for the urgent call to spiritual preparation
